website_summaries.verdict: Very lightweight, quality suitcase that is a great option for carry on luggage.
pros: Available in 5 different colors and features durable wheels and side and bottom carrying handles
Very lightweight and expands up to 2" for additional space
cons: Construction isn't as solid as some other models due to changes to make it more lightweight

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight. 2 Wheels. Plenty of Room
customer_reviews.text: I searched everywhere for a 2 wheeled, VERY light weight carry on bag and this fit the bill. It seemed far too small when I first unpacked the box, however, I needed something that met the international carry-on requirements. I've now used the bag on a few trips and have been completely satisfied with the smooth rolling wheels and can fit more than enough for 10 days into the single large compartment. Since it doesn't have all the extra metal/structural components that add weight and create a sturdier bag, it remains to be seen how long this will last, but so far, I'm 100% pleased. Highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Terri S

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This luggage is a rock star. Used it very recently on a trip to Spain and it held up great. Had to roll it over cobblestone, construction sites, up and down metro stairs, and it kicked butt. This luggage is meant for travelers. Travelpro makes the best!
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Nice luggage but no hook anchor or high impact roller ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice luggage but no hook anchor or high impact roller blade wheels that we use all the time. Flight crew member.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Radar

customer_reviews.title: Quality Lightweight International Size Suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Specified size for Lufthansa International flights. Held all I needed for 11 days in Italy. Loved that it was light enough to lift overhead in the plane and on and off trains. I chose the rollaboard instead of the 4 wheeler because of size and ease of rolling on cobblestone streets. Love this suitcase!
customer_reviews.author: E. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase
customer_reviews.text: I got the 26" to go take to my study abroad program in Lima, Peru for a little over 2 months. I packed this baby full and it still only weighed 35 pounds and it survived a double change of planes and some wicked mountain turbulence just fine. I also have a much more frequently used carry on from Travelpro and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Schoonover

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure How to Rate this Bag
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered the Maxlite 4 but many reviewers stated that the bag tips over (forward) due to the recessed front feet. They made a big change on the new Maxlite 5 front feet so I ordered one with thoughts of returning the Maxlite 4. However, when I received it one of the legs (feet) would not even touch the ground (see photo of leg on right) and it appears not quite as well constructed as the Maxlite 4; shaving off half a pound is not always a good thing. In the end I kept the Maxlite 4.
customer_reviews.author: Cblanca

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Worth it. When it comes to luggage, I've sacrificed quality for a lower price but will not make that mistake again. It's pricey but this is THE suitcase for 5+ days of travel - I packed for 10 days and still had room for more. The handle extends nicely and was sturdy enough to support my heavy laptop via sliding the bag handles over the top of the suitcase handle. I prefer 2-wheeled for their stability and the Maxlite did not disappoint, it also rolled smoothly and handled curbs without issue. Great suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: NicD

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Strong
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 4 weeks tour of South America. After 12 flights and 6 different cities it's still in one piece and looks like new. I will never buy a different brand of luggage again. We had a 50 lbs limit and were able to fit everything we needed for the 4 weeks. The inline wheels on this model is the most durable type of wheels for any luggage. I will buy the matching carry on size for shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I hate to even give this POS one star
customer_reviews.text: I hate to even give this POS one star. Almost immediately after we starting using it on a trip, the telescoping handle broke and would not come out. It made use on the trip extremely impractical and difficult. We threw out this "product" in the middle of our travel and bought another case, which has continued to work properly. STAY AWAY AND DO NOT BUY THIS SUITCASE.
customer_reviews.author: ArmandHamerStore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for Lufthanza carry on
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from Italy and flew out of Venice. Lufthanza agent asked about carry on bags. I showed her the TravelPro bag. She asked me to see if it fit into the 'sizer' to make sure we could carry it on. It fit perfectly. So glad we purchased this size of bag for our international trip. Our older domestic rolling bags would not have fit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, but extremely inaccurate coloring
customer_reviews.text: Overall very impressed with the quality of this bag. I was hesitant about buying a 2-wheeler, however I was pleasantly surprise by mobility and craftsmanship of this bag. This bag is also EXTREMELY (almost impossibley) light weight. It is definitely a bargain for the price. That being said, I was disappointed with the inaccurate color description. The ‘dusty rose’ bag is more of a faded lavender (photo against my true ‘dusty rose’ bed comforter). Might not be a huge deterrent for most, but for people that are seeking that specific color/trying to match to an existing luggage set (like myself), this isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on third day of our trip.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these suitcases for a 30 day trip. One of them came unstitched across the bottom on the third day of our vacation. From then on we had to duct tape the suitcase every time we moved. It was embarrassing for us to have the other people in our group see our suitcases duct taped. I want to return both of the suitcases but Amazon said we were past the return date because our trip was 30 days. This is really a conflict because we could not return them during the trip and we are trying to return them now, as soon as we have returned home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: A wheel fell off after hardly any use. Travelpro's "warranty" is useless. They won't tell you if the repair is covered unless you throw good money after bad by paying to ship the bag to them. Worthless warranty, worthless product. NO MORE TRAVELPRO IN THIS FAMILY!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace one my wife had for the last 25 years...not sure if she would like it but she loved it very nice unit. With the wheels it very easy to move around . It seems to be pretty sturdy. She also loved the color..
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: crappy product and poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: the screw to hold down the handle is loose! only used once..... and no one has returned my email for restitution. absolute BS!!
customer_reviews.author: Flojo

customer_reviews.title: Great choice in luggage!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful suitcase. I'm so glad I bought this. The color is a neat greyish olive, and its nice to have something different than black but still neutral. It has a good amount of space for packing, is light and maneuvers well. All the zippers are smooth and seem sturdy. No problems at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetoread

customer_reviews.title: Frequent traveler - Needs more space
customer_reviews.text: I bought product but returned due to amount of space. The bag seems to be good quality, but I’m a person who likes to take a carry-on bag even on longer trips. For me the interior of this bag was too small. Would have been hard for me to fit a few days of clothes and shoes into the bag least of all a week. As a frequent traveler I want a good bag that can be expanded if need be, but this didn’t fit my needs. I got another Travelpro bag instead that had additional space.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan T.

customer_reviews.title: great piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to take on a two week trip to France and Italy. I was able to pack clothes for the two weeks plus other things like cosmetics and magazines. It was small enough to fit in US planes but I did check it with Air France. Their restrictions are stronger than the U.S. I would highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: CSioux

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had chosen spinner wheels
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted those extra square inches that you don't get in a carry-on with spinner wheels. Unfortunately, this bag was difficult to maneuver. It was heavy to pull through the airport; tricky to navigate narrow airplane aisles; annoying when standing in line. I used the trolley handle to carry the Travelpro Soft Tote, but that just made the suitcase handle less accessible and added to the weight. I found the materials, zippers, etc. to be great quality. For the right travel conditions it deserves 5 stars. But for me, the wheels are a deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Can’t comment on how well it will hold up over time, but you can tell the difference in quality between this and cheaper bags. Although I travel a lot, I don’t think I’d ever spring for a more expensive bag like a Tumi or Briggs. This seems like good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super light sturdy luggage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 22" because my old (12 yrs) Atlantic handle finally broke, and they no longer make a replacement. I can still use it, but can not attatch a second bag. Atlantic is now part of Travelpro, so I expect high quality and long usage from my new bags. When they say light, it is actually an understatement!! Three flight attendants picked up my bag (with four days of clothes and sneakers packed in) and immediately asked me where I bought it, and how much? So, if you need a stable, light, sturdy Rollaboard, the Maxlite 5 is an excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, light and compact
customer_reviews.text: Could fit in a whole week's worth of things for a vacation and did not have to check-in this bag (US domestic, but this one adheres to Int'l carry on restrictions too). It is pretty light which is a big plus, allowing more dense packing for a carry-on only trip. In case one wonders, the shade of pink is not too bright, looks much like what you see in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Shruti Jalali

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Happy purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great value suitcase! Takes a beating and still looks great. Extremely lightweight. The green stands out when waiting at baggage claim amongst the sea of black luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McGavin

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke right away
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. I took it in a 10 day trip and a 5 day trip. On the third trip which was 3 1/2 months after purchase the zipper popped open and would not reclose. The suitcase was only 2/3 full. No stress on the zipper at all. How do you continue a trip when you can’t close your suitcase? When I get home I can try to have them fix it under warranty but I have to pay to ship to them and I will never feel safe using this suitcase again. Who can afford to Have a broken suitcase on a trip of any length? I will never buy TravelPro again.
customer_reviews.author: IloveMosley

customer_reviews.title: It IS light but zippers aren't so strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had this suitcase for about 6 months. Since I got it I've probably used it about 6 times. I do like that it's light weight and it holds a decent amount of stuff but just recently the zipper designed to hold the expansion area closed broke. I've treated this suitcase similarly to a Swissgear suitcase that I had previously and that one had the zippers start breaking after about five years so six months was quite disappointing. If you do get this case, make sure you aren't stressing the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this suitcase for less than 2 years. I arrived at my destination yesterday and the roller handle would not retract. It was fine at the airport but between the car and my room, something inside the button operated, plastic mechanism broke. I'm stuck with the handle extended and no way to check it on the way home. For the price of this bag, it is reasonable to expect more than 20 months of service, many of which were spent quietly stored. Airlines are not gentle but if Travel Pro didn't build it to withstand a little of that, why pay their price? I'll see if they honor any warranty, in which case I will amend this review.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Webb

customer_reviews.title: Big Travelpro fan: Reliable, durable, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I used to have several travel bags. I've discovered that the wheels, zippers and materials on TravelPro bags outlast all the others. I ordered this size for INTERNATIONAL travel: dimensions meet international requirements for a carry-on.
customer_reviews.author: Lorene

customer_reviews.title: arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: The zipper on this luggage was broken before I even packed anything in it to travel. Also, one of the reasons I choose it is because it is supposed to have adjustable handle heights. I am 5 feet tall so wanted the shortest handle adjustment height. That was also defective upon arrival. Only the two tallest handle heights would lock in. Obviously, I returned the case. Very poor quality. I have a hard time believing any frequent traveller or airline personnel would ever use this bag as it's advertisement suggested. I ended up getting a small swiss gear roller bag at Target. I think it will work much better and at least it isn't broken to start with!
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 7 days and company will not replace
customer_reviews.text: I've been a flight attendant for 12.5 years and had several Travel Pro bags which worked well for me. I've used my new bag 7 days and the telescoping handle bent and will not retract. Had absolutely no satisfaction with customer service! The options they offered were to buy a new bag or pay $50-$75 to have it repaired! I have used their products for many years and had no idea that they will not replace a defective item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use - a short weekend trip
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it! Suitcase zipper broke on first use - a short weekend trip. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Golgotiu

customer_reviews.title: watch out for return charges - $18
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase is much larger than I expected an doesn't seem to be of particularly good quality. And I am not crazy about the color. Don't make my mistake and order it as it I costing $18 to return it.
customer_reviews.author: New Mexico Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Travel Luggage
customer_reviews.text: I love this luggage. I chose it because I wanted the lightest most affordable luggage for an extended trip where I was flying. This was perfect. I couldn’t believe how lightweight it was, which allowed me to pack much more of the warm clothes I needed to visit Alaska. It was easy to maneuver, although 4 wheels would have been nicer. Unfortunately, 4 wheels would of also added weight but I was able to stack my carry-on on top of the larger piece to get around.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Easy bag for my wife on our trip to Italy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and she liked it a lot. It was easy for her to pull. It was large enough for her to pack for our 2 week trip. No problem using on Lufthansa as her carry on, with her also carrying on her Personal item, an Osprey Daylite Plus. One thing we worked on hard was keeping the weight down to 8kg. I took a luggage scale so we wouldn't have a last minute surprise at the airport. So far, she's used it once on a US Domestic flight with no problem, but it's incredibly stupid the size rules are different.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Am beyond frustrated
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a very nice suitcase, with good features. But it’s a little small for a week in a cold climate. I’m just so confused about the sizing of luggage. I ordered a 20 inch suitcase which was too small, a 21 inch (because the reviews claimed that an extra inch made a significant difference) which was too small, and now this 22 inch which is too small. All three have identical interior dimensions according to the tags attached to them. I decided that this online ordering wasn’t going to work, so I bit the bullet and went to a mall. The next size up is 25 inches. Enormous. What to do?
customer_reviews.author: Deep in the heart of texas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice roll-aboard
customer_reviews.text: This roll aboard is great-the profile is slightly shorter than my other roll aboard by travel pro, but doesn’t seem much smaller. It’s supposed to be “international” size, and is 21” tall. It’s wide enough to be useful but still works as carry on for domestic flights. The blue is really pretty with a nice lining. The roll aboard doesn’t spin, but rolls well and doesn’t eat up that inside space.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne C

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Perfect carry on. It did not fit the overhead bins in the smaller plane we were in do it got checked. On a regular size plane it would be great. It’s very lightweight. I like how it only has two recessed wheels. There is plenty of room and convenient zippers. Bought a second one for my husband in black.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Flight Attendant MUST Have
customer_reviews.text: Our company uses this brand of suitcases but the one we were “given” is 9 lbs EMPTY! I don’t think people realize that... so when I would pack for 2-6 days my bag was so heavy it was annoying to deal with. I then made the switch to this one and it’s honestly a huge difference! I’ve received a ton of comments on how light my bag is. I’ll never go back to our standard suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Shoes!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for carry on
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased when I open my box and saw the nice quality of this carry-on piece of luggage. Has several handy zippered areas to stash items. Lightweight and has easy maneuverability. Please with my choice after I did an exhaustive search.
customer_reviews.author: Knitty59

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight with good functionality
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version of this a couple years back (think the 3). I can see where they've made improvements to lighten the suitcase. Also, TP has made the front pegs a little longer - avoiding the front falling suitcase the previous version did. Pros - super lightweight and sturdy A zippered area for putting dress shirts inside the top cover portion Quick grab area for passports and wallet Smooth ride What I'd fix - Still think this needs another handle - at the bottom (only one on top and on side) It narrows toward the top. Not sure but this seems smaller than my previous one
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Seems tough and has held up well. Zippers have been trouble free. No problems stowing in upper bulkhead airplane storage. Handle has been durable, as have the wheels. Prefer the straightline, as opposed to swiveling, wheels, so that's a plus. Handy and reasonably commodious outer pockets. No manufacturing defects. Not too heavy, but not flimsy. Holds its shape well. I even like the goofy blue color.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to use as a carry on for domestic flights for stays lasting 4-5 days. I've been able to pack everything I need (toiletries, two dresses, two pairs of shoes, 3 pairs of pants, 4 shirts and a jacket) with room to spare. No problems fitting into the overhead bins and no problems getting it in/out of there. The bag is light, sturdy and rolls easily. I chose the roller board (not spinner) because I wanted more room in the suitcase. Super pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Capacity Galore!
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase had more than enough room for my 1 week trip home for Christmas including Bridesmaid dress and family presents! I used the expandable section for the trip home, and all the zippers worked effortlessly. This rolls and tracks far better than those 'in line skate' type wheels. My two sisters are getting this same suitcase, they loved mine so much! The sage green color is easy to spot at baggage claim too!
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Handle & Wheel problems
customer_reviews.text: The handle would not pull out or retract without MAJOR effort with both hands - ONLY AFTER I PACKED THE BAG FOR THE FIRST TIME - it worked great before it was packed. Also after 1 trip - there was quite a bit of wear on the plastic wheels. The weight & size of the bag were great & I would have loved to have had the bag fixed but had no way to contact mfg - Amazon just automatically got me a partial refund. It was on account of the return time being closed but honestly that makes no sense since there wasn't a problem until I actually packed the bag. Learned a lesson here.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but poor expansion ability
customer_reviews.text: Overall disappointed. Very lightweight, which is awesome, but it’s expansion ability is asinine-who designed this?! Only part of the bag expands. How idiotic. I included a pic to compare the travelpro to a bag I have and need to replace. This travelpro will not be it. Best for small carry on only with no ability to expand. Not great for a traveler who wants to only carry on.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: TRAVELPRO's lovely-as-shown "Dusty Pink" is actually "muddy mauve", just FYI
customer_reviews.text: I have waited for YEARS for TRAVELPRO to offer their highly-rated dependable luggage in lovely colors more distinctive than their ubiquitous black and blue. So many "pretty" bags on the market are so poorly designed and manufactured that they fall apart instantly -- even brands that are known world-wide, believe it or not. So I was overjoyed when TRAVELPRO offered their "dusty pink". I only wish it WERE PINK, but it's not. I haven't decided whether to return it, or just face the fact that -- at least for NOW -- reliable and beautiful cannot be found in affordable bags.
customer_reviews.author: BOOKSY

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great size for a carry on! Was surprised by the amount of stuff I could fit in here. Like the front zipped pouch on the front too. Wish it had 4 wheels (a spinner)...found the two wheels to be clumsy when standing still and putting my purse on it (need to be careful that it does not tip over). Overall, a great bag and I'm glad I got it. This is our sixth Travelpro piece of luggage...all from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic piece of luggage that glides smooth
customer_reviews.text: This is the best carry on I think I have ever purchased. I got this for my mom for Christmas and she loves it. The light green color is really unique and the quality is out of this world. The wheels roll so smooth it’s effortless. The checkered pattern on the inside is sharp and the multitude of compartments is very versatile. I’m probably going to end up getting one for myself now.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Great For Traveling Light(ish)
customer_reviews.text: Traveled around the world for a year with this guy, and it has at least another year of travel left in it. The only noticeable wear is on one wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase for overseas trips!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this suitcase for overseas trips. Fits a lot of clothes and it’s relatively sturdy. I prefer this type of roller wheels because they are not as exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Iscathy66

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well In Europe
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect for our 15-day trip to Europe. The design was well thought out. I did not have any problems maneuvering the suitcase but I might consider getting the 4-wheeler next time just so I don’t have to lift one side of the luggage, when rolling around. I chose the 2-wheeler because it was lighter, but I think I could get away with a heavier suitcase and still not have problems fitting everything I want to bring with me. But to clarify, I don’t regret buying this luggage. For one thing, it was cheaper than the 4-wheeler.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Great size and shape, crap tie-downs and wheels
customer_reviews.text: Frankly I'm likely to buy it again since it is the perfect size/shape for overheads these days. Slight smaller than the 'approved' dimensions with a sloping body and double wheel rollerboard. Tie-downs don't really tighten which got around with compression bags. But like most everyone else review, 8 months one of the wheels disintegrated. Not a good start to a complicated trip.
customer_reviews.author: LA_Biz_Guy

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a flight attendant so I need a sturdy bag. It must be light weight and a reasonable size for international travel. THIS bag is IT!!!!! I absolutely LOVE it. It fits in the overhead bin on any plane and it holds plenty of clothes for any weather. My only negative comment would be that it doesn't have a handhold underneath to grip for stowing. However, this small inconvenience would not deter me from buying another..which I'm thinking about doing..to save!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old, much heavier TravelPro I've used for years. It's a couple of inches larger in length and width, but both are checked-baggage size. This one weighs maybe 1/3 as much as the old one. It maneuvers more easily and has considerably more usable space within. The lack of suit hangers is not a problem since I've found that folding suit jachets works at least as well as hanging them on hangers to keep them wrinkle free while packed.
customer_reviews.author: TWM

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm a flight attendant. Travelpro is high quality, rugged, guaranteed. It's simply the best luggage you can buy, period.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very light but durable
customer_reviews.text: I don't like checking my bags when I travel and spent WAY too much of my time comparing carry on bags. I finally settled on this one since it was on Prime I could return it if I needed to. I didn't. I is a great size and roomy. I recently used it for 5 day vacation. I fit all my clothes in here and only needed my "Personal item" for my toiletries and purse items. This is the perfect size for me. It is light so if the airline weighs your bag it doesn't add a lot of weight. I stuffed this thing full and didn't have any problems with the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: ME0172

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a roller bag. Not a spinner bag. Not only eas it the wrong product it eas used the labeling eas messed up and the wheels were scratched up and worn
customer_reviews.author: TMT

customer_reviews.title: Fits Ryanair carry on size guidelines
customer_reviews.text: We bought this suitcase (the international style) as a carry on for our Europe trip when flying Ryanair for one of the legs, since it actually meets the size requirements for Ryanair carry on, unlike most US sold carry ons. It worked great for that purpose, and we have since used it a few more times as a carry on and a checked bag once when expanded. It can fit a surprising amount of stuff in it when expanded, and it’s still quite lightweight. So far it has held up well even after being checked.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the opportunity to use this carry-on once, for a quick overnight (no plane). With its measurements, I trust that it would be acceptable as a carry-on. It seems to be well-made and designed for practical use. I was amazed at just how much this little suitcase could hold. I was able to pack enough clothing, toiletries and even shoes for both my husband and myself - and I'm not a light traveler! It is lightweight and very maneuverable. So far I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ellingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, stripped-down luggage
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, but I've only gone on one trip with it. It's simple, streamlined luggage. I really like the light-ness of it. I think it might be a little smaller than my old Travelpro 5, but not enough to matter. If you travel a lot, you may want something with more features and pockets. I'm a little worried that it might not be as durable due it's light weight. My thought was, at this price, it would be less expensive to buy a replacement than to buy a really expensive, really durable bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bosef1

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Packed for a 5 day 4 night cross country event, included several pairs of shoes, multi outfits, toiletries and hair care products. Carry on only. No challenge with packing, expanding suitcase, zippers performed well and super light bag only weight was contents. This is my 2nd TravelPro and that first one last 5 years of heavy traveling. Love 2 wheels and easy up n down handle plus side strap to lift and pull from overhead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Lightweight BUT Handle Issues...
customer_reviews.text: This piece of Luggage is extremely lightweight and therefore you can pack more of everything before reaching the 50 lb limit for checked bags. Unfortunately, the handle will not remain in the lower level locked position when the luggage is full. The handle works fine when empty but will only stay locked in the upper most position when it is full. I plan to follow up with TravelPro to see if this is "normal" or if this bag is defective. I would have rated this all 5's if I did not have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bearded

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement in weight over my old Travel Pro and great wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Jackg

customer_reviews.title: Blue easy to find amongst other luggages
customer_reviews.text: Liked the blue for being different and easier to find when it comes out the chute. This worked. Was concerned because it is kinda light, and, yes, it did get a bit dirtier and banged up on just one trip. My first try with the 4 swivel wheels. Took a bit getting used to, but it also could tip and be like a typical 2-wheeled bag. Still, I feel the 4-wheeled guys lose a bit of space inside, so do tend to favor the 2 wheeled ones.
customer_reviews.author: pc

customer_reviews.title: A good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and roomy for it's size. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: 4bear1

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Product
customer_reviews.text: Debated the 4 swivel wheels or just 2. Went with the 2 and wish I had the 4. Lightweight and easily held the clothes for an international journey. Airline wear was not visible. Easy access to the wheels if they need to be replaced in the future. Sturdy zipper and compartments are few but useful. Would recommend, but think hard about the 4 swivel as a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but disappointed in the zippers
customer_reviews.text: I like this suitcase. It’s light weight and doesn’t fall over since it is a two-wheeler. I regularly put about 35-40 lbs of stuff in it (I travel for work and I travel with marketing materials). I check this bag weekly and after the first time I traveled, the zipper on the outside flap got all jinky. Not sure if it’s TSA’s fault or the fault of the zipper, but I’ve never had this happen so quickly on a suitcase (and I’ve owned quite a few of them over the past 3 years).
customer_reviews.author: ScrapNStamp Suz

customer_reviews.title: I like this more than i expected.
customer_reviews.text: Luggage is not very glamorous. I have a similarly colored roller that I picked up in China town 10 years ago and has been around the world several times. No airline has ever cared that it is slightly oversized. With that said, now that I've upgraded, I really like this! Very light. Precise feeling handle. high quality all around.
customer_reviews.author: hiroxbmw

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, well made and roomy carry-on
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to replace my carry on luggage after many years. I chose this Travelpro and I'm glad I did. It is lightweight as described but still well made and seems like it will last a long time. No problem fitting in the overhead bin and interior capacity is roomy. I prefer the 2 wheel rollaboard because the interior space is larger than carry-ons with 4 wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Lilkurty

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Held up in lots of international travel. Roomy. Easy to pull/roll.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: I also got the smaller carry on bag
customer_reviews.text: This luggage held up very well. I'm very pleased. Plenty of compartment space. I even had room for two pair of shoes and my comfy slippers. I recommend Travelpro. If I need to replace another piece of luggage I'll certainly buy another from Travelpro.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lynn Warner-Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, don't spend any more
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot and have the 3rd generation. My husband borrowed my bag and decided to trash his. We bought this 5th gen and it's noticeably better. I appreciate that they fixed a design problem my old bag had. I don't know how those new brands (Arrive) are supposed to come up with a better design on their first try. They are all marketing. TravelPro has the years of experience designed into their latest products.
customer_reviews.author: V. T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this for 3-4 day trips
customer_reviews.text: The only dislike is the inside is like a flannel color but that's just aesthetics and has nothing to do with functionality. I used this to travel to California and it was perfect. The zippers were a bit sluggish at first but now they seem good. It also fit in the overhead luggage compartment overhead in the cabin too so the measurements are perfect for that. Also its spacious and has a good amount of compartments. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Finn

customer_reviews.title: Nice carry-on bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is nice and light and holds more than a similar one I have that's basically the same size. I chose it because it's not a spinner, so the wheels don't add to the dimensions as much as spinners do, which makes more room for whatever you want to put inside. It seems very well made and sturdy. I'm happy with it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B

customer_reviews.title: Quality carry on luggage
customer_reviews.text: This product is great as a carry on luggage. I have used it for international travel and it has fit without issues in the overhead bin without limitations. Good material and holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The best for light travel
customer_reviews.text: I'm the kind of guy who packs one carry-on for a two-week trip. I like to pack light because I hate being weighed down by luggage. This travel bag is perfect for maneuverability, durability, and space. The wheels are sturdy, the bag material is robust, and I can fit as much in it as I can with my shoulder-sling carry-on that I just replaced.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Zipper for smaller compartment broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: Traveled this past week. Zipper on the medium sized compartment broke after one flight. The teeth are not catching and opening up. I have the one zipper just staying up at top right now. Guess that will have to do. Bummed cause overall great suitcase
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Crazy how light weight it is
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this bag yet but I'm very pleased with it. It is super light. I used to be a Flight attendant and used this brand but they were made for crew so they were a bit heavier duty. This bag seems durable and perfect for the ocasional trip. The bag has a nice expensive look to it, though I paid less than 100 bucks. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hoehummer

customer_reviews.title: Great suit case for any travel
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for many business trips. This is a great suitcase for business and personal travel. For business, I can easily fit a suit, extra pair of pants, shirts and everything I need for a 10 day business trip. Has held up very well. For tourism I can easily travel on this for 14 days. Never had an issue with its size in terms of it being allowed as a carry on. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: OTHER THAN A CUT IN THE INTERIOR FABRIC IT'S ALMOST PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I got the case out of the box and was going through all the pockets etc and when I unzipped the main part I found this cut in the fabric. I don't have time to return it and get a replacement. Like the light weigh and the overall size of the suitcase and the pockets are great, I just hope the fabric holds up and that I can fix the cut so it doesn't grow....
customer_reviews.author: jill harmon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: It carries enough for two weeks in Paris and fit the overhead storage on planes We are buying one for each member of the familyh
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jay

customer_reviews.title: Light and roomy
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a two week trip to Scotland over Christmas. It fits a lot: 4 pants, 5 sweaters, pair of flat, one pair of tall uggs, plus undergarments, bag of toiletries, makeup bag, a hefy shawl plus a few odds and end. Plus it's fairly lightweight which is helpful when trying to meet budget airline weight requirements. Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Great Capacity, Easy Maneuverability
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically there’s something about the design of this suitcase that makes it easier and more comfortable to handle than previous suitcases I’ve used. Typically I pack way more than I should. The expandability of this model allows me to pack more, yet it still slips easily into the overhead bin on the airplane. Previous suitcases I’ve used have been a tight fit getting in the overhead bin and getting the bin closed. This one fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smithers

customer_reviews.title: Not expandable all the way around bag, just one side.
customer_reviews.text: It said expandable and my old Travel Pro expanded on all sides, completely around. This Max Lite 5 doesn't. It only expands on one side of the luggage. What good is that? It adds hardly no more real room, just like a little more than an inch.
customer_reviews.author: McGuffin

customer_reviews.title: Love this carry on
customer_reviews.text: Had another brand for years and decided to buy this based on reviews. Love it. Light, well-made, warranty, fits the bill perfectly and I couldn’t be happier. The handles are sturdy, the extending handle has two settings, the zippers are top notch and the pockets are perfectly placed. Looks good, wheels work well and in less than a month it’s been on 4 trips around the US and still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Color
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the dusty pink version. It's hardly passable as pink, it's not even as bright as the photos here. It's closer to purple or mauve in person. Two stars because it's still going to function just fine, it's just luggage, but I spent a lot of time looking for a good pink one and this isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Flight attendant worthy!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and sturdy. As a flight attendant, I need luggage that can withstand the brutality we often inflict on our poor luggage. This looks like it can handle me! If I have problems, I'll update my review but for now, I'm happy. Enough so, that I bought a set for both my sons.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Flight Attendant Approved.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! I’m a flight attendant and although this is not as durable as the travel pro bag we could have purchased from our work, it is cheaper and works great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Shells

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally light and good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good bag for the price and is so light. I bring this bag when I know it will stay with me in carry-on and won’t get checked. Easy to carry on and off subways, even when full. So far I have used it to fit 2 weeks of clothes (mixing and matching outfits), shoes, a toiletries bag, small umbrella and a collection of cords and it isn’t packed to the gills, so for the size the inside is very spacious. Good collection of pockets in the top as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The Rollaboard is very lightweight and seems like it should hold up well with use but have not used it yet, hence gave "Durability" a 3. We have an international trip in March, will let you know how well it travels. The blue color was a bit more subdued than it appeared online which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: BigD1951

customer_reviews.title: Great bag overall
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bag I’ve had. It’s not as big as I thought. Take into consideration it really is 1 inch less than it says. I got 15 days of clothes in it but needed a checked bag for bulkier items for trip to Europe. It’s incredibly sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Dthomp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget-ish option for international travel.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who doesn't check luggage when they travel, it's important to me to have a good, solid carry-on. As a chronic overpacker, I prefer soft-shell luggage. After my last suitcase disintegrated, I decided to finally upgrade to something decent, yet affordable. This suitcase has suited me well (pun intended, so sorry) through two international trips and many cobblestones. Roomy enough to hold enough clothing for a two-week trip, yet small enough to get through international check-ins without issue. The only downside is the wheels - I wish I'd splurged for four-way wheels, but this option is still sturdy, well-sized and lightweight. Very content with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katya

customer_reviews.title: good pull along suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: Held up great on international flight. Went through multiple airports with out issue. Can only be pulled. Can not stand uprights and push along side you. Has 2 fixed wheels. Could have been a little more maneuverable in tight spaces. Had to carry sideways on the plane. Fit in overhead bin without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Penn

customer_reviews.title: Well build, looks great
customer_reviews.text: My husband chose this. I prefer spinner suitcases, which this one isn't. I wish it was as it's a really well-built, nice looking, and well thought out suitcase and I'd like it - if it were a spinner. It stands up on it's own very well, even filled with clothes and other things. My husband is very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: BoiseBell

customer_reviews.title: Travelpro
customer_reviews.text: I have several Travel Pro suitcases. The Rollerboard is much easier to handle & maneuver than having all 4 wheels on a Spinner. Travelpro holds up well & is the lightest suitcases on the market. Used their luggage for many years. The difference between the International & the 22 in. carry on. The International airplane overhead storage bins are 2" smaller than Domestic Airplanes. I highly recommend this Brand either in the MaxLite 4 or Maxlight 5.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Love the luggage but there is a defect
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Travelpro Luggage Expandable Carry-On, Slate Green Sold by: Amazon.com Services, Inc., $101.49 to use for a trip planned for 10/23/19. I returned from a two week trip and absolutely loved this luggage mobility, light weight and interior space for a carry-on luggage. The TRAVELPRO returned from international flights looking unused, but there is a problem that makes the luggage unusable for another trip. The seam of zipper to expand has opened. I am not sure this was unsewed before using. I did not open the expandable section until the return home. I feel the Travelpro carry-on should be replaced but can not locate help for this exchange by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer B.Walker

customer_reviews.title: Suspect Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: The bag looks like it will meet my needs, and until I opened it, looked like it was great quality. Unfortunately the interior zipper is on backwards and without a piece to grasp, and there were strips of what appear to be rigid foam with hot glue that had come detached from the wall. It may not mean anything, but it rapidly changed my initial impression and makes me wonder what other quality issues I'll encounter in the next few months...
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great size and solid TravelPro quality
customer_reviews.text: I travel frequently and need a solid travel bag that is light and easy to fit in various planes. This one is perfect and is the typical quality you would expect from TravelPro. Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Survived an overseas trip
customer_reviews.text: Brought this guy overseas and it came back almost like new. It's easy to wipe down and stores a lot. Easily a week's worth of clothes for a couple travelers. The construction is nice and sturdy. Travelpro did not skip out on the handiwork and materials
customer_reviews.author: Andrew V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 3-4 day bag
customer_reviews.text: I fly for a living and my last TravelPro lasted18 years with only having to replace wheels. So, of course, I went with what I knew and what worked well. This bag is small, light and I can easily pack 3-4 days worth including a pair of shoes and toiletries. Even with 4 days, easily maneuverable in the plane aisle or walking through the terminal. I highly recommend this suitcase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why Buy Anything but Travelpro
customer_reviews.text: Used on 3 international trips. No damage as opposed to my last attempt to buy similar for cheap. Still using a Travelpro from ~30 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Travelpro Maxlite 5-Softside Lightweight Expandable Upright Luggage, Black, Carry-On 22-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Carry-On 22-Inch| Color:BlackRoll onboard with lighter luggage that doesn't sacrifice durability for performance; The Maxlite 5 22" Expandable Rollaboard gives you domestic carry-on convenience in a roomy all-in-one suitcase. Packing is easy and organized with two quick-access, exterior front pockets, full-length interior lid pocket, side accessory pocket and adjustable hold-down straps. Maximize your packing power with a high-tensile-strength expandable zipper that adds up to 2" more capacity, while the 2-position adjustable PowerScope Lite handle and high-performance ball bearing wheels ensure a turbulent-free glide. This Fit to Fly carry-on rollaboard has been sizer been tested to accommodate overhead bin space on most major US airlines. Fully expanded Carry-On may not meet airline restrictions. Backed by Travelpro's Limited Lifetime Coverage plus a new and expanded "Trusted Companion Promise", which covers the cost of repair for damage from airline or other common carrier for 1 year. Also, with our new Trusted Companion Promise, we will even reimburse shipping costs when you send your bag to us for warranty repair or replacement during that 1st year.
feature_bullets: A half pound lighter than the maxlite 4 version, this ultra lightweight, ultra durable 22 inches expandable Rollaboard suitcase maximizes your packing power and meets carry on size restrictions for most domestic airlines; Polyester fabric with stain resistant, water repellant duraguard coating and ergonomic, high tensile strength zipper pulls provide lasting durability
High performance ball bearing wheels and lightweight yet sturdy power scope Lite handle with stops at 38 inches and 42.5 inches reduce wobble and ensure a smooth, easy roll

Expands upto 2 inches to maximize packing capacity with tapered shape to prevent tipping; Features low profile top, side and bottom carry handles, 2 exterior compartments, full length interior lid pocket, side accessory pocket and adjustable hold down straps for packing convenience and flexibility

Limited lifetime coverage plus trusted companion promise, which covers the cost of repair for damage from airline or other common carrier for 1 years; H20 Guard protects the interior lining from moisture
Case Dimensions: 21x14x9 inches, Overall Dimensions: 23x14.5x9 inches, Weight: 5.4 pounds ; Volume : 52 liter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars869 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
